71de17b3-88c0-4af5-998a-663a62cde14a.description: The Program introduces participants to the fundamental concepts and skills required to be a machinist in the field of advanced manufacturing. Topics include measurement tools and systems, blueprint reading, safety, hand tools, manual machines, CNC machining, welding, and shop math and measurement. Students can sit for the National Institute for Metalworking Skills (NIMS) exam for Measurement, Materials, and Safety Certification.
71de17b3-88c0-4af5-998a-663a62cde14a.name: Pre-Apprenticeship Metalwork

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Center for Workforce Development and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: High School Diploma or GED

Entry requirements into program include passing a vigorous application process including aptitude test, interview screening, background checks are evaluated on a case by case basis, and drug tests are pass/fail with no exceptions.
OSHA 10-Hour: General Industry
Forklift Safety Training

Hand Tool Use:  24-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of all hand tools associated with advanced manufacturing. Students have access to all basic hand tools and benchwork in order to understand which tool is right and safest for every job. Tools run the gamut of all facets of manufacturing so students will be able to work in shops throughout the industry.

Shop Math and Measurement: 54-hours – Students learn the basics of measurement, the English and metric systems as well as basic trigonometry, and learn to use measuring tools. Students sit for the National Institute for Metalworking Skills (NIMS) exam for Measurement, Materials and Safety Certification at the end of the course based on skills learned partly in this section.

Blueprint Reading and AutoCAD: 57-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of blue print reading and AutoCAD. Students understand all notes, abbreviations and symbols and learn to read and intercept drawings. Additionally, they learn to map 2D and 3D drawings with AutoCAD software.

Machining: 60-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of machining. Instruction is both academic and hands-on, including but not limited to: grinding, band saw and blades, drill press, lathes, milling machines and CNC machining.  Students demonstrate ability to operate all of the above listed machines and have a basic understanding of machine programming and coding where appropriate.

Welding:  42-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of welding and plasma cutting. Instruction begins on a welding simulator and eventually graduates to hands-on welding where students learn stick and MIG welding. Students are trained in safety procedures associated with welding and leave with an understanding of how to complete a weld from start to finish.

Workplace and Employability Skills: 12-hours – Students work with a career coach/job developer to learn employability skills. Specifically, students work to develop a resume and hone their interviewing skills. Students are coached through employer interviews and ultimately placed in a job or apprenticeship upon graduating the program.

Personal Finance: 3 hours – Students learn the importance of budgeting, saving and managing their finances. Students learn how to manage their own personal budgets and gain a better understanding of financially planning for the future.

3ff97578-570f-49ba-9495-e25bf8cfba48.description: This program introduces students to the fundamental concepts and skills required by electro-mechanical technicians in manufacturing and a variety of industries. Coursework includes Safety, Shop Math and Measurement, Blueprint Reading, Basic Electricity (AC/DC Circuits), Electrical Fabrication, Mechanical Fabrication, Hydraulic & Pneumatic Basics, Troubleshooting, Electric Relay Control concepts and Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs).
3ff97578-570f-49ba-9495-e25bf8cfba48.name: Pre-Apprenticeship Industrial Maintenance

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Center for Workforce Development and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: High School Diploma or GED

Entry requirements into program include passing a vigorous application process including aptitude test, interview screening, background checks are evaluated on a case by case basis, and drug tests are pass/fail with no exceptions.
OSHA 10-Hour: General Industry
Forklift Safety Training

Shop Math and Measurement: 48-hours - Students learn the basics of measurement, the English and metric systems as well as basic geometry and trigonometry. Students define and discuss measurement types, tolerance and are introduced to the concept of inspection, quality control and classes of fits.

Blueprint Reading: 36-hours – Students gain an entry-level understanding of blue print reading. Students learn all notes, abbreviations, symbols and types of views. Students learn to read and intercept drawings. Additionally, they learn the basics of GD&T.

Workplace and Employability Skills:  12-hours – Students work with a career coach/job developer to learn employability skills. Specifically, students work to develop a resume and hone their interviewing skills. Students are coached through employer interviews and ultimately placed in a job or apprenticeship upon graduating the program.

Personal Finance: 3 hours – Students learn the importance of budgeting, saving and managing their finances. Students learn how to manage their own personal budgets and gain a better understanding of financially planning for the future.

Basic Electricity/Electrical Fabrication: 78-hours – Students learn basic electricity and electrical fabrication. Time is equally divided between basic electricity – AC/DC circuits and electrical fabrication. Students learn the fundamentals of electricity, basic electrical circuits, electrical system wiring, circuit protection and conduit bending and threading.

Electric Relay Control/Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs):  36-hours – Students gain understanding of electric relay control and PLCs. Students will understand control logic and sequencing control as well as programming and wiring PLCs.

Mechanical Fabrication:  36-hours – Students gain an understanding of mechanical fabrication. Students have experience with but not limited to: threaded fasteners, wrenches, screwdrivers, torque wrenches, etc., as well as pneumatic and hydraulic system fabrication.

a20a9d43-e1b5-4326-8551-26af48668df5.description: The earner of this badge has completed basic training on the safety and operational aspects of operating industrial powered trucks in the work environment. The earner is knowledgeable of OSHA regulations related to forklift safety. The earner has a broad understandng of topics such as jobsite area inspection, authorization requirements, forklift types, hazard analysis, and pre-operational inspections.
a20a9d43-e1b5-4326-8551-26af48668df5.name: Forklift Safety Training

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Center for Workforce Development and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Meet the objectives of the training course.

40d36c00-5ab5-4a32-8dd1-a56b277fc735.description: This course will focus on process based audits with exposure to live audit scenarios, and the value to the business through internal audits using industry best practices. At the end of the course, students will acquire the needed skills to be able to conduct Internal Audits in any company and establish/verify that the QMS of their organization is compliant to ISO 9001:2015.
40d36c00-5ab5-4a32-8dd1-a56b277fc735.name: ISO 9001:2015 Internal Auditor Training

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Center for Workforce Development and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Have basic reading and writing skills as well as basic aptitude for mathematical statics.
Have professional experience in work and business processes.
Complete Internal Auditor Certification Training course in accordance with ISO 9001:2015 Requirements.
Successfully complete the Internal Auditor Certification course assessment examination.

bd133760-c3a0-42f2-bb57-8efb4c251a83.description: This course focuses on Lean Six Sigma Methodology and how to effectively lead a continuous improvement project. The students work on a project from their industry and choose a key business issue impacting the company's performance. Application of lean six sigma tools to a practical problem provides the knowledge and the skills to make a difference to the company by focusing on cost savings. Coursework strictly adheres to ASQ Body of Knowledge and prepare them for the global certification exam.
bd133760-c3a0-42f2-bb57-8efb4c251a83.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Center for Workforce Development and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Have basic reading and writing skills as well as basic aptitude for mathematical statics.
Have professional experience in work and business processes.
Complete Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification Training course in accordance with American Society for Quality (ASQ) Body of Knowledge.
Successfully complete the Black Belt Certification course assessment examination.

skills.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certificate Program

cd3e38da-313a-434c-91e1-1f9fb28eb4d0.description: This course focuses on Lean and Six Sigma philosophy and how to champion the implementation of an organization's Lean Six Sigma program. Students will learn Lean Six Sigma methodology, how to properly apply Lean and Six Sigma tools, and how to effectively integrate these tools to improve business & production processes, for measurable positive impact to the bottom line. Coursework strictly adheres to ASQ Body of Knowledge and prepares them for the global certification exam.
cd3e38da-313a-434c-91e1-1f9fb28eb4d0.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Center for Workforce Development and authorized by Bucks County Community College

Have professional experience in work and business processes.
Complete Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification Training course in accordance with American Society for Quality (ASQ) Body of Knowledge.
Successfully complete the Green Belt Certification course assessment examination.

skills.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certificate Program

30ebeff9-b4ac-4bc7-9455-1fc45e874de7.description: The earner of this badge has completed training in various types of workplace hazardous, safety PPE, and regulating laws and standards. Topics covered include: Lockout/Tagout; electrical hazards; Hazard communications; confined space safety; hearing conservation; shoe safety; PPE; fall protection; eye protection; forklift safety.
30ebeff9-b4ac-4bc7-9455-1fc45e874de7.name: OSHA 10-Hour: General Industry

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Center for Workforce Development and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Meet all of the objectives of the training course set forth by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

a4d99672-279d-4366-8cc6-a202523a639e.description: The earner of this badge has completed training in various types of workplace hazardous, safety PPE, and regulating laws and standards. This program is designed to follow the OSHA Regulations found in the Code of Federal Regulations.
a4d99672-279d-4366-8cc6-a202523a639e.name: OSHA 30-Hour: General Industry
